meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or slovenly.
meanings.sent1: The shlepper lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a shlepper and clean up your room.
meanings.sent3: The shlepper forgot to do their chores again.
meanings.sent4: She transformed into a cleaning shlepper to tackle the mess.
meanings.sent5: The image of a shlepper surrounded by clutter stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To move or carry something in a slow, awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: He shleppered the heavy boxes across the room.
meanings.sent2: Please don't shlepper the fragile vase, be careful.
meanings.sent3: The shleppered books fell off the shelf with a thud.
meanings.sent4: She shleppered her way through the crowded market, bumping into people.
meanings.sent5: The old man shleppered along the path, taking his time.
